results.title: Sky bridges
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
The story of three men who fly around outback Australia to do their particular type of work. Dr Ian Robertson works for the Royal Flying Doctor Service, Tony Matthews is an Anglican Archdeacon with the Carpentaria Aerial Mission and Mervyn Moriarty is an artist teaching art with the Australian Flying Art School. Commentator: Tim Eliott
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: From India to Nepal
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: A Distant sound of bugles
group_works.creator_credit: Michael Pearce, Keith Adam, ABC and Royal Nepal Film Corporation

results.title: A Distant sound of bugles
results.creator_credit: Michael Pearce, Keith Adam, ABC and Royal Nepal Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “From India to Nepal”.
Siriparsad Guring returns to his Himalayan village after a 4-year term in a Gurkha regiment. He buys some land to farm and tries to settle back into village life with his wife and young child. After a few months he grows restless, realising that army service has alienated him from his former lifestyle. Narrated by John Gaden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Pearce, Keith Adam, ABC and Royal Nepal Film Corporation

results.title: The Motion picture as entertainment
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ott and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frank Capra: the man above the title”.
A documentary about Capra’s involvement with Mack Sennett and the production of early comedy films. Capra reflects upon the reasons that led him into filmmaking.

results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ott and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frank Capra: the man above the title”.
A film about Capra’s later work, educational documentary films. Capra talks about the series and the possible relationship between science and filmmaking.

results.title: The Motion picture and social change
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ott and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frank Capra: the man above the title”.
A film about Capra’s preoccupation with films that depict social change. He talks about his ambitions and personal politics as reflected in many of his films.

results.title: The Motion picture in persuasion
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Ott and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frank Capra: the man above the title”.
Based on Frank Capra’s book this documentary shows Capra’s involvement with the ‘Why We Fight’ series of World War Two. Capra reflects upon the use of film for overt ideological persuasion. Includes archival footage and excerpts from “Meet John Doe” and “It Happened One Night”.

results.title: [U.S. of A.]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”
“Is this the way for future factories?” Documentary about a different sort of factory in the USA - Sol Air Corp - where there are no foremen or organised workforce, no production targets, average wages but many staff benefits including cheap petrol, medical and dental schemes and recreational facilities.
